intro: Senecio silvani, commonly known as the silverleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers are usually yellow with a central disc. Senecio silvani is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
